alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Kennebec; Somerset; Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 08 at 1:35PM EDT until August 08 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is ongoing. Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected to continue through late tonight. * WHERE...Portions of south central, west central, and western Maine, including the following counties, in central Maine, Kennebec, Waldo, Somerset, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Heavy rain from earlier in the day caused flooding of low lying and flood prone areas. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 130 PM EDT, Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Small stream flooding will continue until later tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waterville, Farmington, Fairfield, Skowhegan, Oakland, Pittsfield, Madison, Jay, China and Clinton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
